title: Bug 17825 - ControlExampleText beeps when choosing SWT.MULTI
description: Bug 17825 - ControlExampleText emits a beep when selecting SWT.MULTI. It seems unintended.
OB: Upon choosing SWT.MULTI in the ControlExampleText, a Windows 'ding' is heard (indicating an error).
EB: No audible notification, such as a Windows 'ding,' should occur when selecting SWT.MULTI in ControlExampleText.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch the application using Build F1 (20020521) on Win2K.
2. Navigate to the SWT example ControlExample.
3. Under the 'Text' tab, click on 'Styles' with SWT.SINGLE selected.
4. Click on Styles SWT.MULTI.
